titleStmt.title: A watch-vvord for Kent: and may serve for admonition to Essex, Suffolke, and other counties which doe enjoy the gospell, and their estates in quietnesse. Exhorting Gods people to stir up themselves out of security, and prepare for an heavy iudgement that may be comming upon them: being sermon-notes delivered at Feversham in the county of Kent: / by William Jemmat, Master of Arts: ordered by Parliament to bee preacher there.
titleStmt.author: Jemmat, William, 1596?-1678.

titleStmt.title: A watch-vvord for Kent: and may serve for admonition to Essex, Suffolke, and other counties which doe enjoy the gospell, and their estates in quietnesse. Exhorting Gods people to stir up themselves out of security, and prepare for an heavy iudgement that may be comming upon them: being sermon-notes delivered at Feversham in the county of Kent: / by William Jemmat, Master of Arts: ordered by Parliament to bee preacher there.
titleStmt.author: Jemmat, William, 1596?-1678.

publicationStmt.publisher: for Matthew Walbanke, and are to be sold at his shop at his shop [sic] at Grayes-Inne gate.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
